question: What are two reasons that may result in an IPv6 route missing from EIGRP IPv6 routing table, {Assume EIGRP IPv6 neighbors are established} (Choose 2:)?
options: interface not participating in EIGRP IPv4 routing process

question: Which debug command can be used to troubleshoot mismatched Autonomous Systems with EIGRP, (Choose 1:)?
Which show command can be used with EIGRP IPv6 to display the K metric values, (Choose 1:)?
Which EIGRP IPv4 command can be used to verify if split horizon is enabled and if authentication is being used, (Choose 1:)?
Which two commands can be used to verify EIGRP IPv6 authentication, (Choose 2:)?
Which address will EIGRP for IPv6 use as the Router ID (RID),(Choose 1:)?
options: the highest IPv4 address that is configured on any interface that is Shut down (disabled state)
the highest IPv6 link-local address that is configured on any enabled interface
the highest MAC address that is configured on any enabled interface
the highest IPv6 Global unicast address that is configured on any enabled interface
the highest IPv4 address that is configured on any enabled interface
correct_answers: the highest IPv4 address that is configured on any enabled interface

question: Refer to the exhibit below. Router R1 has recently been configured to operate in an IPv6 only network and is connected via interface Gigabit Ethernet 0/0 to router R2. R2 is configured correctly and link is working fine between R1 and R2. R2 will not form a neighbor relationship with R1 What is the problem, (Choose 1:)?
options: IPv6 Link local address must be configured on interface Gig0/0
EIGRP IPv6 is not activated on Gig0/0
The router ID has not been created on R1
The EIGRP IPv6 process is in shutdown state on R1
correct_answers: The router ID has not been created on R1

question: Customer enabled EIGRPv4 with authentication between 2 routers, however neighbor adjacency is not established, which two authentication parameters need to match in EIGRPv4 authentication configuration, (Choose 2:)?
Refer to the exhibit below. What can the field engineer conclude about the EIGRP authentication between RouterA and RouterB, (Choose 1:)?
options: EIGRP Authentication will fail because the key chain names do not match
EIGRP Authentication will succeed and EIGRP updates can be exchanged
EIGRP Authentication will fail because key ID and EIGRP AS number overlap
EIGRP Authentication will fail because MD5 authentication is only supported with EIGRP named mode
correct_answers: EIGRP Authentication will succeed and EIGRP updates can be exchanged

question: What are two reasons that can cause IPv4 routes to be missing in EIGRP IPv4 routing table, {assume EIGRP neighbors are properly established} (Choose 2:)?
